page.title: 05Manor of Spaunton Court Leet
page.content: Mention is made of Spaunton manor in the Domesday records of 1086. Berringer De Toeni was the first Norman lord of the manor which was later under the care of St.Marys Abbey,York until the dissolution of the monasteries 400 years later. The Darley family took posession in 1780 & are the present owners. The common lands within the manor cover about 7000acres & are mostly moorland. Although owned by the lord of the manor (this is not a true peerage),the charter dictates that ownership carries with it a right for registered commoners to graze their livestock free of charge. The manor also includes the villages of Spaunton,Lastingham,Rosedale,Appleton- le-moors & Hutton-le-Hole.
